Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: யாதானும் நாடாமால் ஊராமால் என்னொருவன் சாந்துணையுங் கல்லாத வாறு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The learned make each land their own, in every city find a home; Who, till they die, learn nought, along what weary ways they roam!.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A learned scholar is shown welcomed warmly into a foreign, exotic city. The local people are offering them food and a place to stay. The scholar looks comfortable and at home.
Layered_Composition.Midground: In stark contrast, an unlearned person is depicted as a lost, weary wanderer in a desolate, alien landscape, with no one to welcome them and no place to call home.
Layered_Composition.Background: A world map is subtly embedded in the background, with all lands glowing welcomingly for the scholar, while the lands appear dark and closed off for the unlearned wanderer.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A contrast between the learned person, for whom every country and town is their own, and the unlearned person, who is a stranger everywhere. It questions why anyone would choose not to learn until death.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The warm welcome symbolizes that knowledge makes one a citizen of the world ('நாடாமால் ஊராமால்'). The weary wandering of the other figure represents the alienation of ignorance.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Welcoming, universal, contrasting with alienation and weariness.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scholar's scene is warm, vibrant, and filled with the golden light of hospitality. The wanderer's scene is cold, desaturated, and cast in the bleak light of dusk.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A split-screen or diptych composition to highlight the dramatic contrast between the two fates.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, photorealistic, with rich cultural details in the welcoming city.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrasting color temperatures and light quality between the two scenes.
